findings.title: Solidity assert violation.
findings.description: The Solidity assert function is used incorrectly, potentially leading to unexpected behavior or errors in the contract.

findings.title: Solidity AssertionFailed event.
findings.description: Solidity assert violation can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation.
findings.description: The contract does not conform to the ERC20 standard.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version.
findings.description: Using an outdated compiler version can lead to potential security vulnerabilities and compatibility issues.

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set.
findings.description: The compiler version is not specified or is set to a floating value, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: The contract uses a right-to-left-override control character which can lead to issues with code readability and maintainability.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol.
findings.description: The code shadows a built-in Solidity symbol, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name
findings.description: The contract has a constructor with an incorrect name.

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable.
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential naming conflict where one state variable has the same name as another state variable, leading to confusion and potentially unintended behavior.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: The local variable declaration has the same name as an existing state variable, potentially leading to unintended behavior or errors.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable.
findings.description: In a function, a parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: This finding indicates that a named return value is shadowing a state variable, which can lead to confusion and potential errors in the smart contract.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect
findings.description: The unary operation does not have any effect on the code, potentially leading to unnecessary operations or overlooked functionality.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: Performing a unary operation immediately after an assignment can lead to unintended behavior and affect the contract's functionality.

findings.title: Unused state variable.
findings.description: The contract has a state variable that is declared but not used anywhere in the code.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: The code has a local variable that is declared but not used anywhere.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: The function visibility has not been explicitly set, which can lead to unintended access and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set.
findings.description: The state variable's visibility is not explicitly set, which can lead to unintended access or modification of the variable.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity functions such as call code(), sha3(), etc.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, …)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and errors.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability.
findings.description: The function's state mutability is incorrectly set, which can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Does the code conform to the Solidity styleguide
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity style guide.

findings.title: External-function name() should be declared external
findings.description: The function name() should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function symbol() should be declared external
findings.description: The function symbol() should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function decimals() should be declared external.
findings.description: The decimals() function in ERC20 contract should be declared as an external function to ensure proper functionality and avoid potential issues.

findings.title: External-function totalSupply() should be declared external.
findings.description: The function totalSupply() should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function balanceOf(address) should be declared external
findings.description: The function balanceOf(address) should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function transfer(address,uint256) should be declared external.
findings.description: The function transfer(address,uint256) should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function allowance(address,address) should be declared external
findings.description: The allowance function with parameters address and address should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: External-function approve(address,uint256) should be declared external
findings.description: The approve function with parameters address and uint256 should be declared as an external function

findings.title: External-function transferFrom(address, address,uint256) should be declared external
findings.description: The transferFrom function with parameters (address, address,uint256) should be declared as an external function for optimization purposes.

findings.title: External-function increaseAllowance(address,uint256) should be declared external.
findings.description: The function increaseAllowance(address,uint256) should be declared as an external function for optimization purposes.

findings.title: External Function Not Declared External
findings.description: The function decreaseAllowance(address,uint256) should be declared as an external function.

findings.title: Shadowing-local: ERC20.constructor(string,string).name shadows ERC20.name()
findings.description: Local variable 'name' in the constructor of ERC20 shadows the state variable 'ERC20.name()', potentially leading to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Shadowing-local: ERC20.constructor(string,string).symbol shadows ERC20.symbol()
findings.description: Local variable 'symbol' in the constructor of ERC20 shadows the state variable 'ERC20.symbol()', potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value by UniswapRouterV2
findings.description: The function _swapUniswap in StrategyBase contract ignores the return value of UniswapRouterV2's swapExactTokensForTokens method.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value
findings.description: The function StrategyBase._swapUniswapWithPath ignores return value by UniswapRouterV2.swapExactTokensForTokens.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value
findings.description: The function StrategyBase._swapSushiswap ignores the return value of UniswapRouterV2.swapExactTokensForTokens, which may lead to unintended behavior or errors.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value in StrategyBase._swapSushiswapWithPath
findings.description: The function _swapSushiswapWithPath in contract StrategyBase ignores the return value from UniswapRouterV2.swapExactTokensForTokens.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value in harvest() Function
findings.description: The StrategyBasisFarmBase.harvest() function ignores the return value of UniswapRouterV2.addLiquidity() which may lead to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unused-return: Ignoring Return Value
findings.description: The StrategyBasisFarmBase.harvest() function ignores the return value of IERC20(token1).transfer(), which can lead to unintended behavior.
